owl:Ontology.terms:creator: Kirner, L., Individualized Production RWTH Aachen
Wildemann,P., Leonhard Weiss GmbH & Co. KG
Oraskari, J., Individualized Production RWTH Aachen
owl:Ontology.terms:description: The Internet of Construction Ontology (IoC) construction process ontology is intended to represent a comprehensive solution of how processes in the construction industry can be modelled. Due to the iterative nature of creating an ontology, the construction process ontology presented here can at best be considered a working state at the time of publication. Our approach emphasizes the simplest and most comprehensive mapping possible, which is only extended based on insights from practical use when otherwise compelling limitations in usability and applicability arise. Thus, the extension and refinement of the developed construction process ontology strongly depends on the integration of further areas of the construction value chain and the connection of further domain ontologies.
owl:Ontology.terms:title: IOC: Internet of Construction Ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: The Internet of Construction Ontology (IoC) is a top-level ontology for describing processes and process-data in the domain of construction. It is a ongoing work as part of the research project “Internet of Construction” that is funded by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research of Germany within the indirective on a joint funding initiative in the field of innovation for production, services and labor of tomorrow (funding number: 02P17D081).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The ioc:Actor that generated the information branch
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: generatedByActor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A responsible person or organization can be assigned to a process with the object property "hasActor"
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasActor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of an actor links to the process actor.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasActorValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The version of a capability a resource inherits
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasCapability

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property for adding a version of a capability requirement to a process
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasCapabilityRequirement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of an capability requirement to one or more capabilities describring a process requirement
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasCapabilityRequirementValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of an capability of a resource to one or more capabilities
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasCapabilityValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Child process of a process. A process can have a undeifned number of children
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasChild

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Points to a version of an element grouping
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasElement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of an Element to one or more elements
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasElementValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to add a version of a initial space, which defines the input of a location or space which the process requires
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasInitialSpace

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of an inistial space to the class describing its exact value
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasInitialSpaceValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Version of an element that the process transforms
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasInputElement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property for linking a version of an element that the process transforms to the speciffic element classes.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasInputElementValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property for connecting a version of a piece of information or a infromation container to a process
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasInputInformation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of an piece of input information to one or more pieces of information
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasInputInformationValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to connect a element, resource or spatial zone.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasLocation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of a location to one or more location instances
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasLocationValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property for connecting a version of a Method. Method can describe an uninstanciated process in general, like "milling" or "fixing"
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasMethod

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of a method to one or more instanciated Methods
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasMethodValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Version of an element that the process has transformed
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasOutputElement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property for linking a version of an element that the process has transformed to the speciffic element classes.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasOutputElementValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property for connecting a version of a piece of information or a infromation container to a process which was transformed by the process
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasOutputInformation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: object property to link a specific version of an piece of output information to one or more pieces of information
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasOutputInformationValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Parent of a Process. A Process can at most have one parent.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasParent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Logical Predecessor of a process. Must be finished for the process to be ready.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasPredecessor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Generalized property to connect a process to a dynamic, version of its process data.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasProcessDataState

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Object property to link a resource, which is defined as pysical or tangible item, material, equipment or asset that is necessary for the successful execution of a construction process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasResource

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Object property to link a version of a resource, which is defined as pysical or tangible item, material, equipment or asset that is necessary for the successful execution of a construction process, to instanciated class
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasResourceValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Object property to connect a detailed and organized plan that outlines the sequence and timing of tasks, activities, and events required to complete a specific process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasSchedule

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Object property to connect a version of a detailed and organized plan that outlines the sequence and timing of tasks, activities, and events required to complete a specific proces to a instanciated Schedule
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasScheduleValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Object property to connect a version of a condition or state of the process. It is descirbed with a combination of bools.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasStatus

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Object property to connect a version of a condition or state of the process to a single, instanciated status. It is descirbed with a combination of bools.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasStatusValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Logical Successor of a process. The process must be finished for the sucessor to be ready.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasSuccessor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to add a version of an output space, thus defining the transformed location or space of the process
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasTargetSpace

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to add a isingle instance to a version of an output space, thus defining the transformed location or space of the process
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasTargetSpaceValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Generic Property to connect ProcessDataStates, which can be versioned, to the actual classes that describe ProcessData.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Object Property to describe the containment of Locations, Resources or Elements in Spatial Zones
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: isContainedIn

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Object Property to describe the containment of Locations, Resources or Elements in Spatial Zones from version to instance
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: isContainedInValue

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property for connecting geometries to elements, resources or spatial zones
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasGeometry

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A optional, internal process mark that can be used to add custom functionality to the process model
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: hasInternalProcessMark

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A boolean that describes if the process was canceled.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: isCancelled

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A boolean that describes if the process was finished.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: isFinished

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A boolean that describes if the process is canceled.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: isPaused

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A boolean that describes if the process is ready to start.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: isReady

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A boolean that describes if the process was started.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: isStarted

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A boolean that describes if a ProcessDataState os considered valid trhough extra validation. WIP
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: isvalid

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: End is when an activity is deemed to have been ended by an entity, known as trigger. The activity no longer exists after its end. Any usage, generation, or invalidation involving an activity precedes the activity's end. An end may refer to a trigger entity that terminated the activity, or to an activity, known as ender that generated the trigger.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: endedAtTime

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: generatedAtTime

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Start is when an activity is deemed to have been started by an entity, known as trigger. The activity did not exist before its start. Any usage, generation, or invalidation involving an activity follows the activity's start. A start may refer to a trigger entity that set off the activity, or to an activity, known as starter, that generated the trigger.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: startedAtTime

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A responsible person or organization. can be assigned to a process
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Actor

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A secondary element that is not part of the realized building afterwards.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: AuxiliaryElement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Refers to the ability or capacity of an individual, organization, system, or entity to perform a specific action, task, or function effectively.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Capability

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The current Intermediate Node which helps to add metadata to the object property connecting the Process to its sepcific ProcessData. Functionality adapted form opm ontology.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CurrentProcessDataState

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A element or a group of elements.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Element

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Structured Process Data. This class is meant to be a loose connection to other files and information containers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A location in the sense of a describable,precise point in space
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Location

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Method that is used to perform the process described. Used as Interface to mor specific domain ontologies.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Method

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The generic class process serves as the central element of the construction process ontology. It can represent a classical process or a subfield common in some definitions such as an activity or a task. Due to the problem of the subjectivity of classifications of the term, no further distinction will be made here.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Process

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Intermediate Node which helps to add metadata to the object property connecting the Process to its sepcific ProcessData
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ProcessDataState

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A basic, unprocessed material that is used to produce goods
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RawMaterial

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: refers to any physical or tangible item, material, equipment or asset that is necessary for the successful execution of a construction process.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Resource

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A process schedule is a detailed and organized plan that outlines the sequence and timing of tasks, activities, and events required to complete a specific process.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Schedule

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Generic Superclass for Spatial Information
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Status refers to the current conditionor state of the process. It is descirbed with a combination of bools.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Status

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: parent for the four explicit types of vCards (Individual, Organization, Location, Group)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: vCard

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space represents an area or volume bounded actually or theoretically. Spaces are areas or volumes that provide for certain functions within a building
owl:Class.rdfs:label: IfcSpace

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Element - Constituent of a construction entity with a characteristic technical function, form or position [[ISO-12006], 3.4.7].
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Element

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A part of the physical world or a virtual world that is inherently both located in this world and has a 3D spatial extent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Zone

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A generic class for defining (planned or executed) construction tasks according to the CTO ontology (see https://mathib.github.io/cto-ontology/)
CTO task method that is used in (L2) and (L3)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TaskMethod

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Geometry of an element.Use https://w3id.org/fog# for Geometry Formats.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Geometry
